name: Game Shows | 10 Question Television Multiple Choice Quiz

questions.text: Who was the very first game show host of "Family Feud"?
questions.explanation:
Richard Dawson.

	Richard Dawson was given a shot at his own game show with "Family Feud".  He was a popular panelist on "Match Game", so the producers decided to give him his own show.  It proved to be a success.  As of 2010, Ray Combs, Louie Anderson, Richard Karn, and John O'Hurley have also hosted alternate versions of the originals.

questions.text: What is the name of the character that wants to take all of your money on "Press Your Luck"?
questions.explanation:
Whammy.

	This show was hosted by Peter Tomarken from 1984-1986.  It was brought back to life in 2002 with a few modifications and is hosted by Todd Newton and is called "Whammy: The All New Press Your Luck".

questions.text: On the original "The Newlywed Game" which of the following were possible prizes for the winning couple at the end of the show?
Which of the following was NOT a panelist on "Match Game"?
questions.explanation:
Wink Martindale.

	Wink was never a panelist on "Match Game".  However, he did have a couple of guest appearances on "Hollywood Squares".  He hosted the following game shows:  "Tic Tac Dough"; "Debt"; and "Gambit".

questions.text: How many contestants was the panelist able to choose from on "The Dating Game"?
questions.explanation:
3.

	This show had several celebrities that showed up looking for love.   Famous stars such as Sally Field, Arnold Schwarzenegger, Tom Selleck, and Farrah Fawcett were on this show.

questions.text: Which of the following has NOT been on the big wheel on "Wheel of Fortune"?
questions.explanation:
Free Letter.

	There is not an option for a person to spin and get a free letter on "Wheel of Fortune". In 2010, the show took off Free Spin and added Free Play in its place.

questions.text: Which of the following game shows centers on music and the music industry?
questions.explanation:
"Rock and Roll Jeopardy".

	Jeff Probst is also the host of the "Survivor" series on CBS.  An interesting side note, he was born in Wichita, Kansas, my home state.

questions.text: Which of the following game shows has Bert Convy NOT hosted?
questions.explanation:
"Jeopardy".

	This lovable game show host died of a brain tumor in 1991. He did not host "Jeopardy".

questions.text: Which game show won the most Emmy Awards for Best Game Show in the 1980s?
questions.explanation:
"The $25,000 Pyramid".

	"The $25,000 Pyramid" hosted by Dick Clark won 6 Emmys during the 1980s.

questions.text: Which of the following was a game on "The Price is Right" while hosted by Bob Barker?
questions.explanation:
All of these.

	These were all on the popular game show hosted by Bob Barker. When he retired in 2007, comedian Drew Carey took over.
